commText: de Kock and Rahul are at the crease. de Kock is on strike. Ishant will open the attack
Ishant to de Kock, 1 run, full outside off, drop and run in front of cover, de Kock is away
Ishant to Rahul, FOUR, Rahul is away with a four. Full inswinger but sliding into leg-stump, glanced to the fine-leg fence
Ishant to Rahul, 1 run, back of a length and again inward shape for Ishant, Rahul punches but it's a thick inside half and is in the air but wide of mid-on
Ishant to de Kock, 1 run, fullish on off, de Kock again defends with soft hands in front of backward point and takes the run
Ishant to Rahul, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

Ishant to Rahul, out Caught by Mukesh Kumar!! Clever from Ishant, bowls the outswinger after a series of inswingers, this is outside off, Rahul gets forward to loft and loses all timing, skews in the air and Mukesh from cover-point takes a very good catch, albeit on the 2nd attempt, he was running back and there was sweeper cover coming in, in his eyeline, so that must have distracted him too. Big wicket and LSG are under pressure already. Replays show that KL lose his bottom-hand after playing that. Rahul c Mukesh Kumar b Ishant 5(3) [4s-1]
Marcus Stoinis, right handed bat, comes to the crease
Ishant to Stoinis, no run, full inswinger and shapes back in from outside off, Stoinis goes for a big drive and it's a thick inside-edge to mid-wicket
Khaleel Ahmed, left-arm fast medium, comes into the attack
Khaleel Ahmed to de Kock, no run, full outside off, driven hard and straight to mid-on
Khaleel Ahmed to de Kock, 1 run, short of length on off, dropped with soft hands near his feet and an easy single
Khaleel Ahmed to Stoinis, no run, full and wide outside off, crunched hard and straight to mid-off
Khaleel Ahmed to Stoinis, no run, short of length and angling away from Stoinis, outside off, left alone
Khaleel Ahmed to Stoinis, FOUR, slower and on a length outside off, width and Stoinis punches airily and wide of cover, almost went all the way, one bounce over the ropes
Khaleel Ahmed to Stoinis, no run, fullish on off, pushed to cover
Ishant to de Kock, wide, short of length but well down leg, de Kock lets it go and Pant dives to his left to take it
Ishant to de Kock, wide, again down leg, de Kock heaves and misses, wide again
Ishant to de Kock, FOUR, de Kock takes the attack to Ishant, short of length and on the stumps, de Kock takes a couple of steps forward, heaves to the vacant deep mid-wicket fence

Ishant to de Kock, FOUR, tough catch and Khaleel at short fine-leg can only parry it to the fine-leg fence. Heaved away again by de Kock and it was flying, Khaleel with one hand to his left and the pace made the ball burst through
Ishant to de Kock, 1 run, slower ball off-cutter on the stumps, de Kock drives to mid-on and takes one
Ishant to Stoinis, 1 run, good length on middle and leg, tucked to deep square leg
Ishant to de Kock, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

Ishant to de Kock, out Caught by Mukesh Kumar!! Ishant has two. Mukesh with another catch. This is a full slower ball on the stumps, de Kock lofts but the bat turns on impact and Mukesh at mid-on jumps at the right time to take a smart catch. de Kock c Mukesh Kumar b Ishant 12(8) [4s-2]
Deepak Hooda, right handed bat, comes to the crease
Ishant to Hooda, no run, short of length outside off, shapes away, Hooda cuts and misses
Axar Patel, Left arm orthodox, comes into the attack
Axar to Stoinis, THATS OUT!! Stumped!!

Axar to Stoinis, out Stumped!! LSG are imploding here. That's a poor choice of shot from Stoinis. He has been asked to wait though by the ump. They are checking if Pant had the gloves were in front of the stumps. It is behind and Stoinis has to go. Wild from Stoinis as he charges Axar and tries to loft, misses the tossed up delivery outside off, easy for Pant who does the rest. Stoinis st Pant b Axar 5(7) [4s-1]
Nicholas Pooran, left handed bat, comes to the crease
Axar to Pooran, FOUR, Pooran will play his shots, no matter the situation. A flat length delivery outside off, slammed over mid-wicket and an aggressive way to start

Ishant Sharma’s wickets in IPL 2024 Shikhar Dhawan Andre Russell Rinku Singh Deepak Hooda Shubman Gill David Miller Virat Kohli KL Rahul Quinton de Kock Except Russell, Rinku and Hooda, all other wickets came in the powerplay.
Axar to Pooran, SIX, even further. Length delivery on middle, Pooran sinks low and slogsweeps miles over deep square leg, almost into the top tier
Axar round the wicket.
Axar to Pooran, no run, so so close to off-stump. Slower and inches from off-stump as Pooran misses the slogsweep, Axar closes his face with his hands in disappointment, that was very close
Axar to Pooran, FOUR, fullish outside off, Pooran throws the bat on the heave, thick inside-edge and wide of backward square leg, runs away to the fence

Axar to Pooran, SIX, Axar can only smile wryly, tossed up on off, Pooran miscued the slogsweep and any other ground he would have holed out to deep mid-wicket but this is the smallest pocket and flies all the way
Hooda is trapped LBW. He reviews at Pooran's behest.
Ishant to Hooda, THATS OUT!! Lbw!!

Ishant to Hooda, out Lbw!! Ishant is on fire. The inswinger gets Hooda. He wastes a review too. This snakes in and Hooda flicks and misses, rapped on middle and leg, three reds and LSG sinking fast. Hooda did not want to review but was asked by Pooran. Hooda lbw b Ishant 0(2)
Ayush Badoni, right handed bat, comes to the crease
Ishant to Ayush Badoni, 1 run, full on the stumps, pushed to mid-on and wide of the fielder, Ayush Badoni is off the mark
Marcus Stoinis vs Axar Patel in T20s Runs: 22 Balls: 39 Dismissals: 3 Avg: 7.33 SR: 56.41 4s/6s: 1/0 Dots: 20
Ishant to Pooran, no run, bouncer on the stumps, Pooran pulls and misses, flies over the head
Ishant to Pooran, 1 run, short of length on off, drop and run in front of backward point
Ishant to Ayush Badoni, 2 runs, fullish outswinger outside off, tapped wide of Khaleel at backward point, a fumble and the second is taken
Ishant to Ayush Badoni, no run, short of length and angling into the fourth-stump, Ayush Badoni plays a neat back foot defence
Mukesh Kumar, right-arm medium, comes into the attack

Over Summary(1-5): *Ishant gets rid of Rahul early *Khaleel starts with a steady over *QDK is removed by Ishant as well *Axar gets Stoinis. He concedes 20 in the rest of the over. *Ishant traps Hooda LBW for a duck
Mukesh Kumar to Pooran, SIX, just clears deep mid-wicket. Pooran is going to swing at everything tonight, by the looks of it. Full on middle, he has miscued the loft but the fielder is not there
Stoinis vs spin in IPL 2024 Runs: 118 Balls: 87 Dismissals: 7 Avg: 16.85 SR: 135.63
Mukesh Kumar round the wicket.
Mukesh Kumar to Pooran, no run, short of length outside off, Pooran mistimes the cut towards backward point and short third man
Mukesh Kumar to Pooran, FOUR, fullish and angling into middle, Pooran heaves it to the deep backward square leg fence, again into the gap
Mukesh Kumar to Pooran, 1 run, slower ball full on the pads, flicked to deep mid-wicket
Mukesh Kumar to Ayush Badoni, no run, short of length and angling into Ayush Badoni who walks into the shot, is squared up a tad and the thick outside-edge goes to short third man
Mukesh Kumar to Ayush Badoni, no run, again Ayush Badoni walks at the bowler, turns the short of length delivery to mid-wicket
Kuldeep Yadav, comes into the attack
Kuldeep Yadav to Pooran, 1 run, sits down and slog sweeps it down to fine leg for a single. Preempted the shot
Kuldeep Yadav to Ayush Badoni, 1 run, turning in, Ayush Badoni waits on it and nudges the ball down to mid-wicket for a single. Played it late
Kuldeep Yadav to Pooran, no run, lovely delivery. Very slow, on the sticks, Pooran paddles it but finds the man at short fine

Three or more wickets within the PP this season 3/14 (3) - Trent Boult (RR) vs MI, Mumbai, WS 3/15 (3) - Sandeep Warrier (GT) vs DC, Delhi 3/23 (3) - Ishant Sharma (DC) vs LSG, Delhi 3/23 (2) - Tushar Deshpande (CSK) vs SRH, Chennai 3/25 (2) - Nuwan Thushara (MI) vs KKR, Mumbai WS
Kuldeep Yadav to Pooran, SIX, slams it over cover! He is in the zone. Reverse slams it well over cover. That was preempted and he smashed the tossed up delivery. This guy is insanely talented
Kuldeep Yadav to Pooran, 2 runs, flatter one, on the sticks, Pooran stays back and tucks it down on to the on-side for a couple of runs. Excellent placement and running
Kuldeep Yadav to Pooran, no run, tossed up delivery, on the sticks, Pooran gets behind it and defends it into the deck
Tristan Stubbs, right-arm off break, comes into the attack
Tristan Stubbs to Ayush Badoni, 2 runs, flatter one, turning in, holds on to the deck a little and has been tucked with soft hands for a brace. Played it into the gap and ran back quickly
Tristan Stubbs to Ayush Badoni, no run, the rate is fine as Pooran has taken care of it. Looks to sweep, gets it off the cue-end and the ball dribbled down to cover
Tristan Stubbs to Ayush Badoni, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

Tristan Stubbs to Ayush Badoni, out Caught by Gulbadin!! Not needed from Badoni. Was a tossed up delivery outside off and Ayush Badoni cue-ended it. The man at long-off was at the edge of the fence and grabbed it easily. Good captaincy from Pant and he is immediately rewarded with a wicket. Was a well tossed up delivery and was doled up well outside off. The batter reached out and fell for the bait. DC break the partnership. Ayush Badoni c Gulbadin b Tristan Stubbs 6(9)
Krunal Pandya, left handed bat, comes to the crease
Tristan Stubbs to Krunal Pandya, no run, quicker one, Krunal Pandya looks to clip it and misses
Tristan Stubbs to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, well doled up, Krunal Pandya on-drives it past the bowler for a single

Tristan Stubbs to Pooran, 1 run, well tossed up delivery outside off, Pooran looked to drive it through the off-side and got it off the inside edge and down to long-on for a single. Excellent over from Tristan Stubbs has pulled back things again for DC. The rate has shot up as well
Gulbadin Naib, right-arm medium, comes into the attack
Gulbadin to Pooran, 2 runs, slower delivery on the sticks, Pooran clips it away with soft hands and nabs a couple of runs
Gulbadin to Pooran, FOUR, short ball, sits up, was a slower one, Pooran had enough time to go back and slam the pull past deep square. Easy four
Gulbadin to Pooran, FOUR, fuller length delivery on the pads, Pooran clips it wide of short fine and that's fifty for Pooran off 20 balls. He is on fire but needs some support from the other end
Gulbadin to Pooran, 1 run, drags one short, outside off, Pooran drags the pull down to long-on for a single
Gulbadin to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, happy to give the strike back. That's what others should do. Nothing fancy. Full, on the pads, clipped down to deep mid for a single
Gulbadin to Pooran, no run, dot ball to end the over. Was a wide short slower delivery and Pooran reaches out for it to cue-end it down to the keeper

22:26 Local Time, 16:56 GMT, 22:26 IST: Time-out. Pooran vs DC from here on. The moment he gets out, it should be game over. Safe to assume it? LSG batting has been abominable to say the least. Ishant has bowled well but LSG batters haven't showed much application with the bat. Pooran has continued with his good form and he needs to carry his bat through.
Mukesh Kumar [1.0-0-11-0] is back into the attack
Mukesh Kumar to Krunal Pandya, no run, starts with a fuller one, at the sticks, Krunal Pandya digs that down into the deck
Mukesh Kumar to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, slaps a length delivery, sends it down to deep cover for a single
Mukesh Kumar to Pooran, 1 run, has been a decent over so far. Was a wide length and slower delivery, Pooran stabs it down to deep cover for a single
Mukesh Kumar to Krunal Pandya, wide, has been wided. Too short, too wide and was an easy call for the umpire
Mukesh Kumar to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, straight down the ground for a four. Low full toss, Krunal Pandya presented the full face of the bat and stroked it back past the bowler. Lovely shot indeed
Mukesh Kumar to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, angling in, whipped down to long-on for a single. Decent over so far

Mukesh Kumar to Pooran, FOUR, and four more. Good end to the over. Was a wide length delivery and Pooran slapped it wide of the cover fielder for a four. The fielder there could have done better. Could have done better to bend down
Kuldeep Yadav [1.0-0-10-0] is back into the attack

Over Summary(6-10): * Pooran continues to attack, six and four off Mukesh * Pooran smokes a reverse hit six off Kuldeep * Stubbs strikes as Badoni holes out to long-off * Pooran brings up his fifty off just 20 balls * Mukesh comes back and concedes 12 runs
Kuldeep Yadav to Krunal Pandya, no run, tossed up delivery, Krunal Pandya pushes it back to the bowler
Kuldeep Yadav to Krunal Pandya, no run, tossed up delivery, Krunal Pandya jumps down and pads the ball down into the deck
Kuldeep Yadav to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, lofted shot! Landed just short of the man at long-off. Was a doled up delivery well outside off and Krunal Pandya slammed it down the ground. Only a single
Kuldeep Yadav to Pooran, 2 runs, well tossed up delivery, Pooran clips it wide of deep mid for a couple of runs
Kuldeep Yadav to Pooran, 1 run, gets it down to deep mid for a single
Kuldeep Yadav to Krunal Pandya, no run, tossed up delivery, reads the spin does Krunal Pandya and pats it down into the off-side
Mukesh Kumar to Pooran, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

Mukesh Kumar to Pooran, out Caught by Axar!! Has been taken by Axar at cover. Clean as a whistle indeed from Axar. Was a short ball, well outside off and Pooran slapped it to find the fielder at cover. The fielder dived to his right and got hold of it. DC should claim the game from now and that too quite easily. 6th one down for LSG. Pooran c Axar b Mukesh Kumar 61(27) [4s-6 6s-4]
Arshad Khan, left handed bat, comes to the crease

Mukesh Kumar to Arshad Khan, no run, angles in, Arshad Khan misses the line of the delivery and the ball took off after landing. The keeper was taken aback as well and was late to grab it. He fumbled it and Arshad Khan wanted to steal a single but Pant recovered in time to have a shy and miss it
Mukesh Kumar to Arshad Khan, no run, banged in, angled across, Arshad Khan dropped his wrists and let it go to the keeper
Mukesh Kumar to Arshad Khan, 1 run, slower length delivery, Arshad Khan stabs it back past the bowler and steals a single. 107 needed off 50 balls now
Mukesh Kumar to Krunal Pandya, wide, angled across, too wide, left alone and has been wided

Mukesh Kumar to Krunal Pandya, 2 runs, slams the pull away and almost sent it into the gap between deep mid and deep square. The fielder at deep square did well to push it to the man at deep mid. Two more added to the tally
Mukesh Kumar to Krunal Pandya, no run, slower one, outside off, Krunal Pandya slaps the drive on the up and finds the man at cover
Kuldeep Yadav to Arshad Khan, 1 run, slower, outside off, dropped little short, chopped down into the off-side for a single

Kuldeep Yadav to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, and four! The runs needed in double digits now. Goes back and punches it. The man at long-on took his eyes off the ball and lets it slip through his legs for a four
Kuldeep Yadav to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, whips the tossed up delivery down on to the on-side for a single
Kuldeep Yadav to Arshad Khan, SIX, straight down the ground for a sixer. Chipped down the track and managed to send it over long-off. Was a good hit indeed
Kuldeep Yadav to Arshad Khan, no run, looks to slog sweep and misses
Kuldeep Yadav to Arshad Khan, no run, stabs it down into the off-side
Ishant Sharma [3.0-0-23-3] is back into the attack
Ishant to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, short, wide, slower, Krunal Pandya stabs it down to deep cover for a single
Ishant to Arshad Khan, FOUR, length delivery, wide outside off, Arshad Khan slaps it down the ground and manages to beat the man at long-off. Was well hit and into the gap
Ishant to Arshad Khan, no run, short, climbs up, Arshad Khan looks to pull but fails to connect on it
Ishant to Arshad Khan, no run, very full, outside off, looks to open the face of the bat and misses
Ishant to Arshad Khan, no run, slower, short ball, Arshad Khan looks to pull it and misses. Was bowled at 123.9 kph. Arshad Khan was a little early into the shot

Ishant to Arshad Khan, SIX, six more! Fuller ball, outside off, Arshad Khan gets under the ball and thumps it over long-on. Was in the slot and put away easily by Arshad Khan. He is playing a good little cameo here. His big shots when connected has gone the distance
Kuldeep Yadav to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, into his final over. Low dipping full toss, slog swept down to deep mid for a single. Didn't place it well

Kuldeep Yadav to Arshad Khan, FOUR, and four. Arshad Khan is impressing. Was a tossed up delivery down on to the pads, little bat on it and the ball ran away fine. DC and Kuldeep Yadav aren't liking this for sure
Kuldeep Yadav to Arshad Khan, 1 run, now a single. Flatter one, Arshad Khan closes the face of the bat and nudges it down for a single
Kuldeep Yadav to Krunal Pandya, THATS OUT!! Stumped!!

Kuldeep Yadav to Krunal Pandya, out Stumped!! Gone. Stumped. Quicker, fuller, outside off, Krunal Pandya has to go. Kuldeep Yadav was clever in bowling it wide. The batter danced down, missed the line as it turned away. The keeper collected it and whipped the bails off in a flash. Krunal wasn't picking him well and has to pay the price for it. LSG need to turn up better in a game where it was pretty much do or die for them. Krunal Pandya st Pant b Kuldeep Yadav 18(18) [4s-2]
Yudhvir Singh Charak, right handed bat, comes to the crease
Kuldeep Yadav to Yudhvir Singh, no run, lovely delivery! Googly. Yudhvir Singh looks to play for the leggie and it turns away to beat the edge. Superb stuff from Kuldeep Yadav
Kuldeep Yadav to Yudhvir Singh, 1 run, and Kuldeep finishes his spell. Was chipped in the air in an uncanny manner and that landed safe. Only a single
Over Summary (11-15): * Kuldeep bowls a quiet over * Mukesh gets the big wicket of Pooran * Arshad keeps boundaries flowing * Ishant finishes his spell - 4-0-34-3 * Krunal gets out stumped to Kuldeep
They need 74 off 30 balls. Only three wickets in hand.
Rasikh Dar Salam, right-arm medium, comes into the attack
Rasikh Salam to Yudhvir Singh, FOUR, four to start the over. Was a length delivery and Yudhvir Singh flogged it across the line and sent it wide of th deep mid fielder for a four

Rasikh Salam to Yudhvir Singh, SIX, and six more. Hang on. LSG mean business? Was a short ball, Yudhvir Singh got hold of it and pulled it behind square for a sixer. Was a seam up short ball and Yudhvir Singh took full toll of it. That was timed so well

Rasikh Salam to Yudhvir Singh, 2 runs, excellent over so far from LSG's perspective. Was on the pads, clipped fine for a brace. LSG would be ruing the loss of so many wickets. Only if they had wickets in hand, this could have been different
Rasikh Salam to Yudhvir Singh, 1 run, length delivery, Yudhvir Singh heaves it down to deep square. JFM drops a dolly. That should have been taken. Casual effort from Fraser-McGurk
Rasikh Salam to Arshad Khan, no run, fuller ball, outside off, Arshad Khan looks to heave it and misses
Rasikh Salam to Arshad Khan, 1 run, lands short of the man at long-off. Was a fuller ball, outside off, Arshad Khan sliced it and the ball landed short of the fielder who was running in from long-off

23:00 Local Time, 17:30 GMT, 23:00 IST: Time-out. LSG have tried to stay afloat. But they have used up too many resources. 60 off 24 balls shouldn't happen as far as DC are concerned. Pant has rung in some smart changes but the fielding from DC has been awful. They have dropped catches and their ground fielding has been sloppy as well. The last lap is here and Pant needs one final hurrah from his bowlers. Khaleel, Mukesh and Salam have the onus on them.
Khaleel Ahmed [1.0-0-5-0] is back into the attack
Khaleel Ahmed to Arshad Khan, no run, dot ball. DC like it. That was a superb yorker. Tailed in late and Arshad Khan got the bat down in time to jam it out into the deck

Khaleel Ahmed to Arshad Khan, SIX, and sixer. Arshad wants to fight here. Was a short ball, slower, Arshad Khan gets hold of the delivery and spanks it over deep square. That was massive. 54 needed off 22 balls now

Khaleel Ahmed to Arshad Khan, wide, bowls it fuller, down leg, Arshad Khan misses the clip and has been wided. Pant does well to grab it. 53 needed off 22 balls. DC for some strange reasons decided to review it and there was no bat on it

Khaleel Ahmed to Arshad Khan, SIX, wow! Wow. Where had you been young man? Was a fuller length delivery, angled in, Arshad Khan whipped it over long-on. This is superb batting. 47 needed now. DC under pressure

Khaleel Ahmed to Arshad Khan, FOUR, and some deft touch. Short, wide, Arshad Khan slower, Arshad Khan arched back and opened the face of the bat t get it wide of the dive of the man at short third. 43 needed now

Khaleel Ahmed to Arshad Khan, leg byes, 1 run, looks to tuck it away and gets it off the pads into the off-side for a single. 42 needed off 19 balls. RCB fans and CSK fans are on the edge of their seats
Khaleel Ahmed to Yudhvir Singh, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

Khaleel Ahmed to Yudhvir Singh, out Caught by Shai Hope!! Hope takes it. Much needed wicket. 18 off the over and a wicket. Was a back of a length delivery and Yudhvir Singh wanted to punch it. The man at long-off steadied himself and took it easily. The ball seemed to be stuck on to the deck a little. Big wicket for DC as this partnership was reaching threatening proportions. Yudhvir Singh c Shai Hope b Khaleel Ahmed 14(7) [4s-1 6s-1]
Ravi Bishnoi, right handed bat, comes to the crease

Rasikh Salam to Arshad Khan, 1 run, low full toss, Arshad Khan creams it down to long-off for a single. Timed it well for sure. Arshad for sure can do this as he is timing the ball so well and seeing it fine as well
Rasikh Salam to Ravi Bishnoi, 1 run, just what Ravi Bishnoi needs to do. Fuller one, outside off, pushes it wide of mid-off for a single. 40 needed off 16 balls

Rasikh Salam to Arshad Khan, SIX, straight down the ground for a sixer. 34 needed now. This man is on fire. LSG hopes are reignited. That was a fuller ball outside off and Arshad Khan slapped it down the ground and over the bowler's head for a sixer. Muscled hard by Arshad Khan. He has moved to 47
Rasikh Salam to Arshad Khan, 2 runs, two more. 32 needed now. 14 balls to go. Slower, wide, Arshad Khan stabs it down to long-off for a brace. Poor fielding from DC continues

Rasikh Salam to Arshad Khan, 2 runs, 30 off 13 balls now. Slower, wider, Arshad Khan slaps it down the ground and the man at long-off dives to stop it. They get a brace. But take a moment and soak up everything this lad has done so far. Fifty off 25 balls from Arshad Khan
Rasikh Salam to Arshad Khan, 1 run, cue-ends the thwack down to long-off for a single as it angled across outside off. Wanted a single and gets a single
Mukesh Kumar [3.0-0-27-1] is back into the attack
Mukesh Kumar to Arshad Khan, 1 run, Mukesh's experience has to come to the party for DC. Was slapped down the ground and landed just short of the man at long-on. Only a single. I0$
Pant having long chats with his wards.

Mukesh Kumar to Ravi Bishnoi, 1 run, top-edge. Lands well short of the man at deep mid. Was a short ball, well outside off, Ravi Bishnoi looked to pull it and the ball landed well short of the man at deep mid. 27 needed off 10 balls now
Direct hit from the deep mid region and Fraser-McGurk has come up with a superb throw.
Mukesh Kumar to Arshad Khan, THATS OUT!! Run Out!!

Mukesh Kumar to Arshad Khan, out Ravi Bishnoi Run Out!! 1 run completed. Ravi Bishnoi had to charge back for a brace and he should have made it as well but the sensational direct hit from the deep didn't help. Was a low full toss, Arshad Khan tucked it down and looked to come back for a second. Ravi Bishnoi wasn't really late for the second but JFM's throw was powerful and accurate as it hit the base of the sticks to catch him well short. Ravi Bishnoi run out (Fraser-McGurk) 2(2)
Naveen-ul-Haq, right handed bat, comes to the crease

Mukesh Kumar to Arshad Khan, no run, it didn't land in line and that helped the batter. Was a fuller ball, Arshad Khan looked to heave it but missed the line of the delivery. DC decided to review but have lost it
Mukesh Kumar to Arshad Khan, 1 run, whips a fuller delivery down to deep mid for a single. Was a low full toss from Mukesh Kumar. 25 needed off 7 balls now

Mukesh Kumar to Naveen-ul-Haq, 2 runs, for a moment I thought he was short. Was a fuller ball, outside off, Naveen-ul-Haq steered it down and got it wide of the man at deep third man. Naveen-ul-Haq decided to come back for the second and dived to make it. Good running from Naveen
Rasikh Salam to Arshad Khan, no run, 23 off 5 balls now. Low full toss, was clubbed down to long-off. The bat face twisted on impact

Rasikh Salam to Arshad Khan, 2 runs, 21 needed now off 4 balls. Fuller ball, Arshad Khan looks to use his bottom hand and gets it down to deep mid. The fielder in the deep fumbled and allowed the second to happen

Rasikh Salam to Arshad Khan, 1 run, only a single. 20 off 3 shouldn't happen. This is great news for RR, SRH, RCB and CSK. Fuller ball, whipped down to long-off for a single. Arshad Khan has decided to take the single. The ball to be changed with only three balls to go
Rasikh Salam to Naveen-ul-Haq, no run, looks to play the reverse shovel and misses. Was a slower one outside off and Naveen-ul-Haq missed it

Rasikh Salam to Naveen-ul-Haq, no run, DC will end their campaign with a win. But will it be enough? Not at all. Their NRR is very poor. Was a slower one, outside off, Naveen-ul-Haq looked to heave it and missed it
Rasikh Salam to Naveen-ul-Haq, no run, that's it. DC end with 14 points. Was right up there and Naveen-ul-Haq whipped it back to the bowler. I0$DC have won this by 19 runs

23:27 Local Time, 17:57 GMT, 23:27 IST: DC will be pleased that they have signed off with a win here. Technically, they might still make it but their NRR is too much in the negative for them to have realistic hopes of making it to the next round. Only if they had Pant for the last game and they could have performed better. Things might have been a little different for them. LSG needed 209 for a win and they were never in the chase. They lost four in the powerplay and that kind of dented them in the chase. Pooran then sparkled like he has in the entire season and scored 61 off 27 balls. His dismissal would have meant it was all over for LSG but they unearthed a new talent in the form of Arshad Khan. His 58 off 33 balls kept LSG in the game even till the 19th over. But DC just about held their nerves to clinch it. A loss here might have just closed the road for LSG. They would be gutted. Their NRR took a beating in the game against SRH and now this loss. Stay tuned for the presentation...

KL Rahul | LSG captain: I feel the wicket remained the same throughout the 40 overs. When we got JFM out in the first over we should have capitalized, but they - Hope and Porel - showed a lot of intent. We did well at the back end and 200 was a par total, we should have chased it down. This has been a problem right through the season - we keep losing a lot of wickets in the powerplay, we never get a solid start to get the likes of Stoinis and Pooran in, that is the big reason why we are in this position.

Kuldeep Yadav: It was a good wicket to bowl, especially for spinners, 2nd innings I was getting a little bit of rip, was trying to spin the ball as much as I can. The length is key, wicket was slow, so trying to be fuller. The revs is very important, if it's a quick track, it's easy to adjust the length but if it's slow you have to be perfect. I try to push a few balls and revs is very important for any wristspinner. That's how cricket is, we just came here to win the game and we won and that's more important to us. Let's see in a couple of days' time which team goes through.

50-plus scores from No.8 or below in the IPL 79*(32) - Rashid Khan (GT) vs MI, Mumbai WS, 2023 66*(34) - Pat Cummins (KKR) vs CSK, Mumbai WS, 2021 64*(25) - Andre Russell (KKR) vs SRH, Kolkata, 2024 64(24) - Harbhajan Singh (MI) vs PBKS, Mumbai WS, 2015 61(28) - Ashutosh Sharma (PBKS) vs MI, Mullanpur, 2024 58*(33) - Arshad Khan (LSG) vs DC, Delhi, 2024 52*(41) - Chris Morris (DC) vs MI, Mumbai WS, 2017

Most bowlers used in an IPL match 16 - RCB vs GL, Bengaluru, 2016 16 - PBKS vs LSG, Mohali, 2023 15 - DC vs LSG, Delhi, 2024 Today was the 20th instance of a team using eight or more bowlers in an IPL innings, the first by DC.
DC in IPL 2024 \nHome: five wins, two defeats \nAway: two wins, five defeats
DC defending 200-plus totals in the IPL \nMatches: 13 \nWon: 13
The only other teams with a 100% record defending 200-plus totals in the IPL are MI (14 out of 14) and LSG (two out of two).
Stats by Roshan Gede

Rishabh Pant | DC captain: Definitely Pooran was giving us a hard time. We had certain plans. The total was good enough. We kept on bowling good balls. I would say the start of the season was with a lot of hopes. Some injuries. We are still in contention even after the last game. We had a better chance of qualifying if I would have had a chance to play in the last game. Personally, it was fantastic to come back. Was heartening to see the support from entire India. Was a long time to wait after one-and-a-half years. I want to be on the field all the time. Don't want to miss any action.

Ishant Sharma | Player of the Match: The last few games I was trying to bowl a knuckle ball. Even in the last game I got Virat out and today KL. I don't think much. I take it as it comes everyday. If my body is alright, I should thank Patrick [Farhart]. I had some injuries. After the defeats, we were positive and there was belief as well. If you win close games, it gives you confidence to take the momentum forward.

That should be it for DC and LSG for the season. LSG though have a game in hand but they have too much to do and even mathematical help won't be enough. Same goes for DC who though have wrapped their campaign up with a win. RR are through as mentioned earlier. SRH have two more games and would need one win to confirm their play-offs spot. RCB vs CSK might well turn out to be a winner takes the last spot kind of a game. IPL usually on the last lap is frenetic and that's exactly what's happening now. Every result ensuring the calculators are pulled out and the permutations and combinations are done. Our maths is done for the day as another game of IPL has ended. Our team of Akshay Maanay, Siva and Kumar Abhisekh Das bids you bye bye!
